title: Rhian Brewster explains how he fits himself into the Liverpool XI on FIFA 20
text:

Rhian Brewster abandons Jurgen Klopp's 4-3-3 formation and plays with four strikers to get himself into the starting XI on FIFA 20.

That's according to the man himself, who says he'd even sit on the bench before sacrificing one of the Reds' electric front three of Roberto Firmino, Sadio Mane and Mohamed Salah.

Brewster made a first senior start for Liverpool in the recent Carabao Cup victory over MK Dons.

The teenager has a tough task in ousting Firmino from his regular spot in the team, but reckons there may be a way they can both play together - as he discovered on FIFA.

(Image: EA Sports)

"I don't [replace any of the front three], I play 4-2-4 on FIFA, I play all of us don't worry about that," Brewster told Mirror Football at the FIFA 20 World Premiere.

"I put myself up front - actually, do you know what, to be fair, I normally put myself on the bench and then later when we're winning I'll stick myself up front and get some more goals."

Like many young footballers, Brewster is a big fan of the EA Sports game and rates his ability.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

When asked who's the best FIFA player at Liverpool, he responded: "Me. No doubt. I know Trent [Alexander-Arnold] is going to come in here and talk some nonsense that it is him, but it's not. It's me."

Rhian Brewster was speaking at the FIFA 20 World Premiere. EA SPORTS FIFA 20, featuring VOLTA FOOTBALL, is out on September 27 for Playstation 4, Xbox One and PC. To pre-order your copy, head to https://www.ea.com/en-au/games/fifa/fifa-20/buy.
description: EXCLUSIVE: The Liverpool forward confidently claims he is the best FIFA player at the Anfield club
